central.name: One Nation One Subscription
central.description: One-stop digital library in India with institutional access to global research in various academic disciplines.

central.name: PM Vishwakarma
central.description: Aims at improving the quality as well as the reach of products and services of artisans and craftspeople and to ensure that they are integrated into the domestic and global value chains.[19]

central.name: Amrit Bharat Station Scheme
central.description: Scheme to redevelop existingrailway stationsand make stations more comfortable and convenient for passengers, and to transform them into vibrant city centers.[20]

central.name: PM eBus Seva
central.description: PM-eBus Sewa supports public transport by deploying 10,000 electric buses under aPPPmodel. It aids in reducinggreenhouse gas emissionsand includes urban mobility projects like theNational Common Mobility Cardfor seamless travel in urban areas.[21]

central.name: Mahila Samman Savings Certificate (MSSC)
central.description: MSSC Scheme was launched by the Government of India in Budget 2023 for women and girls in India.

central.name: Agnipath Scheme
central.description: The Agnipath Scheme will be the sole method for recruiting soldiers below the rank of commissioned officers into the three branches of the armed forces. Under this scheme, all recruits, referred to as "Agniveers," will serve for a fixed term of four years. "Agniveer" will also be introduced as a new military rank.

central.name: PM Poshan Shakti Nirman Abhiyaan(PM-POSHAN, Prime Minister's Overarching Scheme for Holistic Nourishment, (lit) PM Nutrition Power Building Scheme)
central.description: Revamped version of 1995Midday Meal Schemeto provide free lunch to school children. Financial outlay in 2022 was₹10,233crore(equivalent to₹110 billion or US$1.4 billion in 2023).[7]Grouped under the umbrella scheme "SakshamAnganwadiand POSHAN 2.0", it aims to reducing stunting, under-nutrition, anemia, and low birth weight.[22][23]

central.name: PM SVANidhi
central.description: Provides working capital loans to street vendors in urban areas, incentivizing repayments and digital transactions.[24]

central.name: Strengthening Teaching-Learning and Results for States(STARS)
central.description: To improve school education in six states covering 10 million teachers.[25][26]This is a continuation of GOI-World Bank efforts since 1994 towards the same goal.[25]Implemented throughSamagra Shiksha Abhiyan.[25]

central.name: Svamitva Yojana(Survey of Villages Abadi and Mapping with Improvised Technology in Village Area)
central.description: To help in mapping of properties in villages with the help of drones. Aims in helping to reduce disputes over property. The portal will help in making it easier for villagers to avail bank loans.[27]

central.name: Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyaan(Poor Welfare Employment Campaign)
central.description: Employment campaign for the poor following coronavirus pandemic covering 12 ministries and 6 states. Launched on 20 June 2020 and ended on 22 October 2020.[28]

central.name: PM Matsya Sampada Yojana(PMMSY, PM Fish Resources Scheme)
central.description: Nationwide welfare measures for farmers in the fisheries sector. For the period 2020-2024 estimated allocation of₹20,050crore(equivalent to₹220 billion or US$2.7 billion in 2023) for implementation.[29]

central.name: PM Kisan Samman Nidhi(PM KISAN, PM Farmer's Tribute Fund)
central.description: Income support of₹6,000(equivalent to₹6,700 or US$80 in 2023) per year to eligible farmers throughDirect Benefit Transfer.[30]

central.name: Jal Jeevan Mission(Water Life Mission)
central.description: Accelerated Rural Water Supply Programme began in 1972.[31]Restructured into National Rural Drinking Water Programme (NRDWP) in 2009.[32][31]To provide water to each rural household through individual taps. Financial outlay in 2022 is₹60,000crore(equivalent to₹670 billion or US$8.0 billion in 2023).[7]Consists of 'Har Ghar Nal Se Jal' or 'Nal Se Jal Scheme'.[31][33]AlsoHar Ghar Jal.

central.name: Atal Bhujal Yojana(Atal Jal, Atal Groundwater Scheme)
central.description: World Bank funded scheme (50:50) to improve ground water management with focus on Panchayats. Implementation in seven states between 2020 and 2026 with initial funding of₹6,000crore(equivalent to₹67 billion or US$800 million in 2023).[34]

central.name: PM Kisan Urja Suraksha Evam Utthan Mahabhiyan(PM KUSUM Scheme, PM Energy Security and Upliftment Campaign)
central.description: For the installation of solar pumps and other renewable power plants across the nation targeted towards farmers.[35]TowardsParis Agreementtargets forrenewable energy.[36]

central.name: PM Shram Yogi Mandhan(PM SYM)
central.description: Social security to unorganized sector and through voluntary contribution and monthly pension after 60 throughdirect benefit transfer. Implemented byLICand CSCs.

central.name: PM Annadata Aay Sanrakshan Abhiyan(PM AASHA, Farmer Income Protection Scheme)
central.description: For farmer welfare through creating a profitable ecosystem for selected products. Consists of sub-schemes such as Price Support Scheme (PSS) and Price Deficiency Payment Scheme (PDPS).[37]

central.name: Ayushman Bharat Yojana(AB PM-JAY, Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana, People's Health Scheme)
central.description: Ayushman Bharat National Health Protection Scheme (AB-NHPS) aims to provide free access to healthcare for 50 crore people in the country.[38]Implemented across India expect 3 states/UTs.[39]By July 2021 Ayushman cards issued numbered 16.14 crore.[39]By March 2022 hospitalisations under the scheme had crossed 30 million with a valuation of₹35,000crore(equivalent to₹390 billion or US$4.6 billion in 2023).[40]

central.name: Samagra Shiksha(National Education Mission)
central.description: To improve overall effectiveness of schools from pre-nursery to class 12 and other measures.[41]In 2022 it financial outlay allocated₹37,383crore(equivalent to₹420 billion or US$5.0 billion in 2023).[7]SubsumesSarva Shiksha Abhiyanand others. World Bank supported.[25]

central.name: PM Jan Vikas Karyakaram(PMJVK, PM People Progress Programme)
central.description: Started in 2008 as Multi-sectoral Development Programme (MSDP).[42]Development of minority concentration areas.[42]

central.name: Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan(RGSA, National Village Swaraj Campaign)
central.description: To strengthenPanchayati Raj institutionsand support them towards achievingSustainable Development Goals.[43]

central.name: World Class Institutions Scheme
central.description: To enable 10 private and public institutions to attain world class academic and research facilities. Aim is to createInstitutes of Eminence.[44]

central.name: Khelo India– National Programme for Development of Sports
central.description: Sporting infrastructure, sponsorship, excellence. Competitions such asKhelo India University GamesandWinter Games. General fitness of the population.

central.name: Saubhagya Yojana
central.description: Last-mile electrification for all households in India. The program focuses on providing power to unelectrified homes, boosting quality of life and aiding socio-economic growth in rural and remote areas.

central.name: Krishonnati Yojana
central.description: Umbrella scheme subsuming 11 schemes.[45]

central.name: PM Matritva Vandana Yojana(PM Maternity Support Scheme)
central.description: Launched as the Indira Gandhi Matritva Sahyog Yojana in 2010. Renamed in 2017. A cash incentive of not less than₹6,000(equivalent to₹6,400 or US$75 in 2023) to pregnant/lactating women.[46][47]

central.name: Digital Payment Infrastructure
central.description: Encourages digital transactions through platforms likeUPI,RuPay, andFASTag. It is a part of India's strategy to create a cashless economy, improving financial inclusion and transparency while reducing reliance on cash-based transactions.

central.name: PM Ujjwala Yojana(PM Lighting Scheme)
central.description: Launched to provide free LPG connections to women from below poverty line families.[48]

central.name: UDAN
central.description: Regional Connectivity Scheme (RCS) - UDAN promotes affordable air travel by connecting unserved and underserved airports. It boosts regional connectivity and supports infrastructure upgrades for tier-2 and tier-3 cities.

central.name: PM Fasal Bima Yojana(PM Crop Insurance Scheme)
central.description: Insurance and finance scheme for farmers.[49]

central.name: Stand-Up India
central.description: Loans forscheduled castes, scheduled tribesand women entrepreneurs for greenfield enterprises. Loans can be applied online.[50]By July 2021, 1.16 lakh loans disbursed amounting to₹26,204crore(equivalent to₹290 billion or US$3.5 billion in 2023).[51]By 2022, 81% of loan beneficiaries are women.[52]

central.name: National Hydrology Project
central.description: Multi-pronged project to improve hydrology related practices. World Bank supported.[53][54]Australian Water Partnership (AWP) provides technical assistance. The Hydrology Project started in 1995 and was expanded through the National Hydrology Project in 2016.[55]

central.name: PM Krishi Sinchai Yojana(PMKSY, PM Agriculture Irrigation Scheme)
central.description: Multi-pronged scheme focusing on improving agricultural productivity through irrigation support and better practices. In 2022 financial outlay is₹10,954crore(equivalent to₹120 billion or US$1.5 billion in 2023).[7]Part ofRashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojna.

central.name: PM Mudra Yojana(PM Micro Units Development and Refinance Agency Scheme)
central.description: MUDRA is a financial institution for funding small businesses.[56]34,42,00,000 beneficiaries have received₹18.6lakhcrore(equivalent to₹21 trillion or US$250 billion in 2023).[57]New entrepreneurs consist 22% of the beneficiaries.[58]

central.name: Smart Cities Mission
central.description: Redevelopment,retrofitting, greenfield development of 100 cities.[59][60]Large diversity in success of implementation.[61]

central.name: Digital India
central.description: It aims to ensure that government services are available to citizens electronically and people get benefits from the latest information and communication technology.[62]Has expanded into production linked incentives, promotion of electronics manufacturing, R&D and improvement of theNational Knowledge Networkand electronic governance.[7]

central.name: Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Electric (& Hybrid) Vehicles in India Scheme(FAME India Scheme)
central.description: Part of the National Electric Mobility Mission Plan (NEMMP) 2020.[63]

central.name: PM Gramin Awas Yojana(PMAY-G, PM Rural Housing Scheme)
central.description: Original form 1985.[64]Provides financial assistance to rural poor for constructing their houses themselves. This generates income and employment as well.[65]Sample housing designs have been proposed throughUNDP, MoRD andIIT, Delhicollaboration.[66][67]

central.name: PM Awaas Yojana - (Urban)(PMAY-R, PM Housing Scheme Urban)
central.description: To enable better living and drive economic growth stressing on the need for people centric urban planning and development. It envisages a "Slum Free India" in which every citizen has access to basic civic infrastructure and social amenities.[68]By March 2024, 56,20,000 units had been delivered to beneficiaries.[69]

central.name: Atal Pension Yojana(Atal Pension Scheme)
central.description: Original form in 2010 as the Swavalamban Yojana.[70]A pension program that allows people to make voluntary contributions within a certain range with a matching government contribution to receive pension in the future. By September 2021, non-metros subscribers numbered 3,77,00,000.[71]

central.name: PM Suraksha Bima Yojana(PMSBY, PM Safety Insurance Scheme)
central.description: This accident insurance scheme is for individuals and can be renewed every year. By May 2021, over 80,000 claims valuing₹1,629crore(equivalent to₹18 billion or US$220 million in 2023) registered.[72]

central.name: PM Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana(PMJJBY, (lit) PM Life Light Insurance Scheme)
central.description: This life insurance scheme for individuals can be renewed every year.[73]

central.name: Unnat Jyoti by Affordable LEDs for All(UJALA)
central.description: Replaced the "Bachat Lamp Yojana". Reduces the cost of energy-savingcompact fluorescent lamps. By the end of 2021, 36,78,00,000 LEDs were distributed resulting in energy savings and reduction in emissions.[74]

central.name: PM Kaushal Vikas Yojna(PM Skill Development Scheme)
central.description: To provide encouragement to youth for development of employable skills by providing monetary rewards by recognition of prior learning or by undergoing certification training at affiliated centres.[75][76]

central.name: Heritage City Development and Augmentation Yojana(HRIDAY)
central.description: The scheme seeks to preserve and rejuvenate the rich cultural heritage of the country.[77]

central.name: Sukanya Samridhi Yojana(Girl Child Prosperity Scheme)
central.description: The scheme underBeti Bachao Beti Padhaoprimarily ensures equitable share to a girl child in resources and savings of a family in which she is generally discriminated as against a male child.[78]

central.name: PM Bhartiya Jan Aushadhi Kendra(PM Indian Public Medicine Scheme, PMBJK)
central.description: The scheme launched by the Department of Pharmaceuticals, Govt. Of India, to provide quality medicines at affordable prices to the masses.[79][80]

central.name: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana
central.description: Started as Aajeevika -National Rural Livelihoods Mission(NRLM) in 2011.[81]Self-employment programme to raise the income-generation capacity of target groups among the poor. The scheme has been merged with another scheme namedSwarnajayanti Gram Swarozgar Yojana(SGSY).

central.name: National Career Service(NCS)
central.description: The objective of this project is to help job-seekers land up at the job they deserve.Under this scheme, an online job-portal named as National Career Service portal has been launched which acts as a common platform for job-seekers, employers, skill providers, government departments, placement organisations and counsellors.[82][83]

central.name: Deendayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojana
central.description: Programme for creation of rural electricity infrastructure and household electrification for providing access to electricity to rural households.[84]InitiallyRajiv Gandhi Grameen Vidyutikaran Yojanalaunched 2005.

central.name: Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation(AMRUT)
central.description: Preceded byJawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Missionstarted in 2005. Water based project to cover urban water ecosystem including taps, conservation and reducing flooding.[85]

central.name: Swachh Bharat Abhiyan(Clean India Mission)
central.description: Central Rural Sanitation Programme (CRSP) launched in 1986. In 1999 it became the Total Sanitation Campaign (TSC).[86]Multiple objectives including elimination ofopen defecation, addressing manual scavenging, and good sanitation and waste related practices.[86]

central.name: PM Jan Dhan Yojana(PM's People's Wealth Scheme)
central.description: National Mission for Financial Inclusion to ensure access to financial services. Replaced 2011Swabhiman. The scheme resulted in 36.86 crore new in-use bank accounts by mid-2021.[87][88]

central.name: Deendayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana(DDU-GKY, Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Rural Skills Schemes)
central.description: A scheme to engage rural youth, especially BPL and SC/ST segments of the population, in gainful employment through skill training programmes[89]

central.name: Namami Gange Programme
central.description: National Ganga Plan was launched in 1985. Integrates the efforts to clean and protect River Ganga in a comprehensive manner.[90]

central.name: Rajiv Gandhi Scheme for Empowerment of Adolescent Boys(Saksham)
central.description: Aims at all-round development of adolescent boys and make them self-reliant, gender-sensitive and aware citizens, when they grow up. It covers all adolescent boys (both school going and out of school) in the age-group of 11 to 18 years.[91]

central.name: Sansad Adarsh Gram Yojana(SAGY, Saanjhi, Member of Parliament Model Village Scheme)
central.description: To develop model villages.[92][93]223 CS/ CSS and 1,806 state schemes converge under SAGY.[94]By 2016, members of parliament adopted 703 Gram Panchayats.[95]

central.name: Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan(National Higher Education Mission)
central.description: Improving the quality of higher education in India.[96]

central.name: One Stop Crisis Centre(Sakhi)
central.description: Centre to provide multiple form of aid and shelter to women who have face violence.[97]By 2018, 234 centres had been set up.[98]By 2021 there were 700 centres with plans to set up centres in foreign countries.[99]Some centres lack required facilities.[100][101]

central.name: Direct Benefit Transfer(DBT)
central.description: State level electronic benefit transfer and Direct Cash Transfer piloted before.[102][103][104]Under the Cabinet Secretariat and Ministry of Finance.[105]By 2022, over 300 schemes and 50 ministries are implemented using DBT.[105][106]

central.name: Scheme for Adolescent Girls(SAG, Adolescent Girls (AG) Scheme)
central.description: Formed in 2010 by combiningKishori Shakti Yojanaand Nutrition Programme for Adolescent Girls (NPAG) schemes into theRajiv Gandhi Scheme for Empowerment of Adolescent Girls(RGSEAG) or Sabla.[107]Implemented with UmbrellaIntegrated Child Development Services(ICDS) Scheme,[108]and then placed under Saksham Anganwadi & Mission Poshan 2.0.[109]Empowering adolescent girls aged 11–18 years with focus on out-of-school girls by improvement in their nutritional and health status and upgrading various skills like home skills, life skills and vocational skills.[110]

central.name: PM Adarsh Gram Yojana(PM Model Village Scheme)
central.description: Integrated development ofSchedule Castemajority villages.[111]

central.name: Promotion of University Research and Scientific Excellence(PURSE)
central.description: To improve infrastructure towards excellence in science and research. Universities to have benefitted include Cochin University of Science and Technology,[112]Mahatma Gandhi University, Kottayam,[113]Kashmir university,[114]Jammu University,[115]Punjab University,[116]University of Delhi,[117]Jadavpur University[118]and Amity University, Rajasthan.[119]

central.name: Clean Energy Research Initiative(CERI)
central.description: Improving research capacity with regard to clean energy.[120]

central.name: Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research Programme(INSPIRE Programme)
central.description: Scholarships and internships for top science students, fellowships for pursuing PhD, research grants to researchers.[121]

central.name: Cognitive Science Research Initiative(CSRI)
central.description: To work towards scientific quality of life improvements for those with cognitive disorders.

central.name: Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana(RSBY, National Health Insurance Programme)
central.description: Health insurance to poor (BPL), domestic workers, MGNERGA workers, rikshaw-pullers, building and other construction workers, and many other categories as may be identified by the respective states.[122]

central.name: National Action Plan for Climate Change(NAPCC)
central.description: Improving science and technology capabilities with regard to climate change.[123]

central.name: PM's Employment Generation Programme(PMEGP)
central.description: Aimed at providing employment and self-employment to unemployed.[124][125]Implemented byKhadi and Village Industries Commissionas nodal agency.[126]

central.name: Gramin Bhandaran Yojana(Rural Godown Scheme)
central.description: Now subsumed under Agricultural Marketing Infrastructure (AMI).[127]Creation of scientific storage capacity with allied facilities in rural areas to meet the requirements of farmers for storing farm produce, processed farm produce and agricultural inputs. Improve their marketability through promotion of grading, standardisation and quality control of agricultural produce.[128]

central.name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana(RKVY, National Agriculture Development Programme)
central.description: Allocation in 2022-23 crossed₹10,400crore(equivalent to₹120 billion or US$1.4 billion in 2023).[129]IncludesPradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojna(Per Drop More Crop) and agricultural mechanization.[7]

central.name: National Mission on Nano Science and Technology
central.description: "Umbrella capacity-building programme" targeted towards Nano Science and Technology.[130]

central.name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MG-NREGA)
central.description: Legal guarantee for one hundred days of employment in every financial year to adult members of any rural household willing to do public work-related unskilled manual work at the statutory minimum wage of Rs. 120 per day in 2009 prices.[131][132]

central.name: Pooled Finance Development Fund Scheme(PFDF)
central.description: The scheme enablesUrban Local Bodies(ULBs) including small and medium-sized municipalities to raise credit from the market on a sustainable basis to meet their investment needs. PFDF will provide credit enhancement to ULBs to access market borrowings based on their credit worthiness through state level pooled mechanism.[133][134][135]

central.name: National Creche Scheme
central.description: Rajiv Gandhi National Crèche Scheme for Working Mothers[136][137]

central.name: Janani Suraksha Yojana(Maternity Safety Scheme)
central.description: One-time cash incentive to poor pregnant women andAccredited Social Health Activist(ASHA) for institutional/home births through skilled assistance to reduce child-mother mortality.[138]

central.name: National Health Mission
central.description: To improve India's health sector. Financial outlay in 2022 was₹28,859crore(equivalent to₹320 billion or US$3.8 billion in 2023). Includes a number of (subsumed) programmes such as National Mental Health Programme (1982), National Blindness Control Programme (1976) and National Vector Borne Diseases Control Programme (2003).[7]

central.name: Livestock Insurance Scheme
central.description: Initiated as a pilot in 2005 and scaled up to all districts by 2014. Insurance to cattle and attaining qualitative improvement in livestock and their products.[139]

central.name: Special Accelerated Road Development Programme(SARDP-NE)
central.description: To improve road connectivity in Northeast India.[140]

central.name: Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya(Kasturba Gandhi Girls School)
central.description: Educational facilities (residential schools) for girls belonging toSC,ST,OBC, minority communities and families below the poverty line (BPL) in educationally backward blocks.

central.name: National Pension System
central.description: Contribution-based pension system. For government employees in 2004 and the general public in 2009.

central.name: Deendayal Disabled Rehabilitation Scheme
central.description: Original form was the 1999 scheme to Promote Voluntary Action for Persons with Disabilities, with the aim of implementing Persons With Disabilities Act, 1995. DDRS to create an enabling environment to ensure equal opportunities, equity, social justice and empowerment of persons with disabilities.[141][142]

central.name: PM Swasthya Suraksha Yojana(PMSSY, PM Health Protection Scheme)
central.description: Improving distribution and accessibility of health services. NewAIIMSwill be constructed under the scheme.[143]

central.name: Sampoorna Grameen Rozgar Yojana(Universal Rural Employment Scheme)
central.description: Providing additional wage employment andfood security, alongside creation of durable community assets in rural areas.

central.name: Swadhar Greh Scheme(Swadhar, Self-reliance Home Scheme)
central.description: For women in tough circumstances.[144][97]

central.name: PM Gram Sadak Yojana(PMGSY, PM Village Road Scheme)
central.description: Good all-weather road connectivity to unconnected villages. World Bank supported.[145]

central.name: Antyodaya Anna Yojana(AAY, Antyodaya Food Scheme)
central.description: Under the scheme, 1 crore of the poorest among the poor (BPL, below poverty line) families covered under the targeted public distribution system are identified. Issue of ration cards following the recognition of Antyodaya families; unique quota cards to be recognised and "Antyodaya Ration Card" must be given to the Antyodaya families. The scheme has been further expanded twice by additional 50 lakh BPL families each in June 2003 and in August 2004, thus covering 2 crore families under the AAY scheme.[146]

central.name: Kishore Vaigyanik Protsahan Yojana(Young Scientist Incentive Plan)
central.description: National fellowship and scholarship programme to encourage students to take up research careers in the areas of basic sciences, engineering and medicine. Exam administered by theIndian Institute of Science.[147][148]

central.name: National Social Assistance Programme
central.description: Financial assistance to pensioners, widows and other target categories.[149][150]

central.name: Members of Parliament Local Area Development Scheme(MPLADS)
central.description: Each MP has the choice to suggest to the District Collector for works to the tune of Rs 5 crores per annum to be taken up in their constituency. The Rajya Sabha Member of Parliament can recommend works in one or more districts in the State from where he/she has been elected.

central.name: National Scheme on Welfare of Fishermen
central.description: Financial assistance to fishermen for construction of house, community hall for recreation and common working place and installation of tube-wells for drinking water.

central.name: National Social Assistance Scheme
central.description: Public assistance to its citizens in the case of unemployment, old age, sickness and disablement and in other cases of undeserved want.

central.name: Eklavya Model Residential School(EMRS)
central.description: Setting up of newEklavya Model Residential Schoolsand improving existing ones. Improvement of enrollment.

central.name: National Tuberculosis Elimination Program(NTEP)
central.description: Tuberculosis control initiative.

central.name: Voluntary Disclosure of Income Scheme
central.description: Opportunity to the income tax/ wealth tax defaulters to disclose their undisclosed income at the prevailing tax rates.

central.name: Infrastructure Facilities for Judiciary
central.description: This includes residential facilities, digital facilities,Gram Nyayalayas.[151]

central.name: National Child Labour Projects(NCLP)
central.description: Launched in 9 districts in 1987 and has been expanded in 2005 to 250 districts in 21 different states. The objective of this project is to eliminate child labour in hazardous industries by 2010.Under this scheme, the target group is all children below 14 years of age who are working in occupations and processes listed in the Schedule to the Child Labour (Prohibition & Regulation) Act, 1986.

central.name: Interlinking of Rivers Project(ILR, NPP, National Perspective Plan)
central.description: Development of water resources.[152]

central.name: Urea subsidy
central.description: The first urea subsidy scheme was in 1977 in the form of Retention Price cum Subsidy scheme (RPS). From₹4,389crore(US$2.51 billion) in 1990 to₹75,849crore(US$17.43 billion) in 2008. As %ofGDP this is an increase from 0.8% to 1.5%. In 2022-23 financial outlay is₹63,222crore(equivalent to₹710 billion or US$8.4 billion in 2023).[153][154]

central.name: Integrated Child Development Services
central.description: The scheme aims to tacklemalnutritionand health problems in children below 6 years of age and their mothers by providing cash incentives conditional upon registration atAnganwadicentres and vaccination of newborn children.[97]

central.name: Food subsidy
central.description: In 1972 the total food subsidy was₹117crore(US$154.84 million). In 1980 it was₹662crore(US$840.1 million) and₹5,250crore(US$1.62 billion) in 1995.[155]In 2022 financial outlay was₹2.06lakhcrore(equivalent to₹2.3 trillion or US$27 billion in 2023). Allocation in 2020-21 had reached₹5.41lakhcrore(equivalent to₹6.1 trillion or US$72 billion in 2023), an all-time peak.[156][157]

central.name: National Service Scheme
central.description: Personality development through social (or community) service.

central.name: Kerosene subsidy
central.description: Eliminated in 2021.[13]
